On Apr 12, 2007, at 7:22 AM, Kenneth Stanley wrote:

> To add on to Jason's point about network activation,

Hi Ken,

Sorry, I replied independently to Jason before seeing your reply.  I  
understand your preference.  I'm wondering if you've ever observed  
any performance difference in NEAT in using either activation style?

Certainly, I'd expect the sorted-single-activation to use less CPU,  
particularly with larger data sets and as networks grow in size.   
But, if it's at the expense of poorer NEAT performance, I'd like to  
know.  I always assumed that the evolution would take care of it  
either way.

--Steve
--Apple-Mail-13-516892151
